entry.title: Technical Debt in Python
entry.summary:
Description

Kate Heddleston , Shift

**Technical Debt in Python**

Technical debt is something that every team has to deal with at some point; often sooner than you'd think. This talk is about what is technical debt, what specifically does it look in python, and how can you think about reducing technical debt.

entry.title: Usable Ops: How to make web infrastructure management easier.
entry.summary:
Description

Speakers: Kate Heddleston, Joyce Jang

As developer tools increase in power, the systems weâ€™re able to build do too. However, with great power comes great...complexity, and the systems we build today are more complex than ever before. This talk is about reducing the complexity of your web infrastructure, and making it easier for developers on your team to learn, use, and manage your infrastructure.

Slides can be found at: https://speakerdeck.com/pycon2016 and https://github.com/PyCon/2016-slides

entry.title: Choose Your Own Django Deployment Adventure
entry.summary:
Summary

From WSGI servers and reverse proxies to continuous integration and automated configuration management, the Django deployment environment is a complicated collection of tools for developers new to the framework. This talk explains the most confusing Django deployment topics as chosen by the audience in real-time via text message votes. Bring your phone to participate!

Help us caption & translate this video!

http://amara.org/v/FPWh/

entry.title: Technical Onboarding, Training, and Mentoring
entry.summary:
Summary

With the increase of code academies training new engineers there is an increase in junior engineers on the market. A lot of companies are hesitant to hire too many young engineers because they lack sufficient resources to train them.

Help us caption & translate this video!

http://amara.org/v/FPWe/

entry.title: Keynote: The Ethics of Being a Programmer
entry.summary:
Summary

Keynote of the second day of PyCon SE 2015

entry.title: Chef: Automating web application infrastructure
entry.summary:
Summary

This talk is going to focus on using Chef to create web application projects, specifically a python project with a Django framework. Chef is a configuration tool for managing infrastructure by allowing users to automatically and reproducibly configure installations on servers. This talk will cover what is Chef, why automated server configuration is important, and how Chef can be used personally.

entry.title: Technical on-boarding, training, and mentoring.
entry.summary:
Summary

This is a talk about how to make junior and new engineers into independent and productive members of your engineering team faster and cheaper. We will focus on python specific resources and libraries that will help you create a simple but effective on boarding program, and talk about case studies of companies that have had success using these techniques.

entry.title: So you want to be a full-stack developer? How to build a full-stack python
entry.summary:
Summary

This is a talk about building full-stack python web applications where you manage every part of the application yourself. I will walk through how to setup a production server with your web application code, a local development environment using vagrant, and how to deploy from your local environment to production. I will also walk through python and Django libraries that will make your life easier.

entry.title: Choose Your Own WSGI Deployment Adventure
entry.summary:
Description

From servers and proxies to configuration management, the Web Server Gateway Interface (WSGI) deployment ecosystem is complicated for new developers. This choose your own adventure talk contains decision points for the audience to choose topics via text and email votes. Each choice leads down a separate path to explain different confusing WSGI subjects. Bring your phone or laptop to participate!

entry.title: How our engineering environments are killing diversity (and how we can fix it).
entry.summary:
Description

This talk focuses on how engineering team environments can impact employee behavior, and how environmental factors can prohibit diversity at tech companies. I will talk about some of the key problems that exist in current engineering environments and how they can be fixed.
